SYP3060 - Sociology of Sex and Reproduct.name: SYP3060 - Sociology of Sex and Reproduction

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000 or PSY 2012, or Junior Standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sociological theories and research examining sexuality and reproduction in contemporary U.S. society.

SYP3300 - Fads, Crowds, and Social Actio.name: SYP3300 - Fads, Crowds, and Social Action

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of relatively unstructured social situations, such as mobs, crowds, etc. as well as more structured forms of collective behavior such as social movements.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, SYG 2010 or Junior Standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sociological perspectives on video games as interactive digital entertainment, including theoretical approaches with respect to gender, race, violence, and capitalism as they relate to gaming.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Context and essential sources of social development and change.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sociological examination of the types of, and societal reactions to, deviant behavior with special emphasis on stigmatization.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An analytical study of murder in the U.S.; topics include different types of homicides, offenders, victims, and circumstances.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Chief causes of antisocial behavior and current methods of prevention and reform. Effects of heredity and environment, prevalence of delinquency and crime, penal institutions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: SYG 2000, ANT 2000 or PSY 2012, or Junior Standing

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sexual violence in contemporary societies, including its causes and impacts, and related prevention and intervention efforts.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Types of delinquency behavior found among juveniles; possible causes and ways society attempts to treat the various forms of delinquency.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The relationship between law and society, including the functions of law and its organization, social and economic consequences, jury selection, and modern trends.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the nature of alcoholism and review of its impact on society.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sociological perspectives on all forms of domestic violence, including theoretical explanations, prevalence, risk factors, dynamics of prevention, and intervention.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The role of popular music in social change and in reflecting American culture. Consideration is given to the nature of the popular music business.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the relationship between contemporary popular culture and social institutions, collective identities, social change, gender, ethnicity and age.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Utilization of sociological concepts and theories to investigate sport as a social institution. Includes subjects of racism, sexism, drug abuse, violence, and current issues of sport.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of social perception, attitude formation and change, motivation, and decision-making in small groups as affected by social interaction and social processes.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sociological examination of social problems as an emergent process that involves collective definitions and legitimating organizations. Topics include deviance, race, gender and popular culture.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000 or SYG 2010 or ANT 2000 or PSY 2012 or Junior Standing, or CI.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores the ways in which happiness and well-being are understood from a sociological perspective and dependent upon cultural, historical, and social factors.

SYP4044 - Social Capital and Caregiving.name: SYP4044 - Social Capital and Caregiving from an International Perspective

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Any of the following: SYG 2000, SYG 2010, or CI.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A sociological perspective on caregiving, which is an expression of social capital defined by supportive networks and relations. Includes a study abroad component (Cork, Ireland .

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Comparative sociology of revolutions and the sociological research on social movements.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, SYG 2010, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores primary trends and processes related to life in a consumer society.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theoretical and empirical examination of the sociological process of global stratification and the countervailing force of an emergent anti-globalization social movement.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Social roots, culture, circumstances, prevention, and control of violence.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Issues related to victimology such as victimization risks and societal treatment of victims.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Types of gangs, gang members, activities, group processes, and societal responses to gangs.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of the socio-cultural elements of the drug culture.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The use of film to examine important social issues related to crime, substance use, health, war, social inequality, and the environment.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sociological aspects of aging in America.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, SYG 2010, ANT 2000, or CI

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Social factors and institutions fostering health and positive aging, a time for potential growth and self-renewal rather than of decline.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A sociological examination of older populations within minorities: ethnic minorities, women, and gay men and lesbians.
